title: Through Charlie's Eyes
features: Through Charlie´s Eyes is a book about a little Pomeranian named Charlie that lost both his eyes. In sharing Charlie with you, the author´s wish is that he will be as inspirational to you as he is to her every single day.
So come along, and see the world 'Through Charlie's Eyes'
For Charlie's full story go to facebook.com/Eyes4Charlie
description: This week we got Linda Hueftlein & Charlie's Book: Through Charlie's Eyes. This is my son who is 12, the book was perfect for him to better appreciate what all his pets have & develop empathy for those who have been injured or abused. Such a gentle book, the poem at the end broke my heart as my son read it to us. This book should be taken to children in hospitals that might relate to Charlies story, along with some companion dogs of course. Charlie is so special thank you Linda for sharing his world with us. Kisses to CharlieLinda...Thanks so much for writing such a beautiful story of Charlie's journey. Charlie's book came today!! I love it!Charlie and Mom Linda....just had to let you know that I received my copies of "Through Charlie's Eyes" today!!! This wonderful tribute to our little man Charlie is everything (and much more!!) that I thought it would be. I must admit that I actually shed tears as I read this book...Happy Thanksgiving to you, Charlie, and your family. We are spending today reading our Charlie book that came in yesterday's mail. Love it!

Linda Hueftlein is retired and currently lives with her husband in Phoenix, Az. She shares her home with Charlie, 2 other rescue dogs, 1 rescue cat and 7 parrots, several of whom are either rescued or rehomed. Charlie was adopted June 1, 2013 in Phoenix. For Charlie's full story go to facebook.com/Eyes4Charlie

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/69u5oi983vsrhha0bljotjvof9._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Linda M. Hueftlein', 'about': ["I am Charlie's Seeing Eye Person. I was born and raised in a small town north of Kansas City, Mo. I have lived in Colorado, where my daughter and her family still are, and currently reside, with my husband, in Phoenix, Az.", 'I have been a book nerd all my life. Whenever I could read, I did. In the tub, eating, watching tv, you name it! Sadly, I no longer have the luxury of reading every waking moment.', 'My other passion is animals. I have 3 rescued dogs and 6 parrots. We all live together peacefully, albeit not always quietly.', 'After retiring in March 2013, I adopted Charlie in June. Charlie has been such an inspiration and support to me, that I felt motivated to share him in the hopes that he will encourage others who may be going through some difficult times in their lives, and be the inspiration he is to me every single day.', 'Charlie IS my Hero', 'Facebook.com/Eyes4Charlie']}
